description: head of a man in profile, looking toward PR; man has curly hair and long beard and wears a cap with a rolled brim at the nape of his neck; small strip of paper at bottom of image with two collectors' stamps
inscription:
Inscription and Stamp

on back, in blue ink: [(illegible) / 1977]; on back, in pencil: [Ambrogio Figina 1550-1595]
markings: LRC, stamped in red: [CARLO / PRAYER]; Lugt 2044;  LLC, stamped in blue: [GV] Lugt 1223
provenance: Giuseppe Vallardi, Lugt 1223 (1784-1863), Milan. Carlo Prayer, Lugt 2044 (1826-1900), Milan. Juan (d. 1920) and Felix (d. 1914) Bernasconi, Milan, Lugano, and Argentina; by descent to Maria Bernasconi (in 1977); Bernasconi sale, Christie's, London, July 5, 1988, part of no. 195, for Â£724.75, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1988-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Head of a Bearded Man in Profile
